removals.reasoning: Extra parentheses around a cast-expression are redundant; casts already bind tightly.
Extra parentheses around a cast-expression are redundant; casts already bind tightly.
Extra parentheses around a cast-expression are redundant; casts already bind tightly.
Extra parentheses around a cast-expression are redundant; casts already bind tightly.
Extra parentheses around a cast-expression are redundant; casts already bind tightly.
Both the outer grouping parentheses and the inner grouping around the cast operand are unnecessary; chained casts are unambiguous.
Both the outer grouping parentheses and the inner grouping around the cast operand are unnecessary; chained casts are unambiguous.
Both the outer grouping parentheses and the inner grouping around the cast operand are unnecessary; chained casts are unambiguous.
In array indexing, * has higher precedence than +; grouping adds no clarity here.

Parentheses around the product and the whole quotient are unnecessary; * and / have the same precedence and left-to-right associativity. Also the extra parentheses around i and j after the cast are not needed.
Parentheses around a single variable following a cast are unnecessary.
Parentheses around a single variable following a cast are unnecessary.
Addition and subtraction have the same precedence and left-to-right associativity; grouping is redundant.
Assignment has lower precedence than +; grouping is unnecessary. Also parentheses in the index expression are not needed.
Grouping the entire RHS is unnecessary; also the extra parentheses around n in the cast are not needed.
Parentheses in the index expression are unnecessary due to operator precedence.
Grouping around a simple subtraction on the RHS of an assignment is unnecessary; also removes redundant index parentheses.
Parentheses in the index expression are unnecessary due to operator precedence.
